result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia A Plumley

records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM; Case called for Hearing. Attorney Brandon Carlson, for attorney Peter M Wolff, in court for Patricia A Plumley.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Carlson advises Atty. Wolff has discovery but no offer yet.  Atty. Carlson requests another further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  State advises there is an offer in the file and will forward it to Atty. Carlson as well as Atty. Wolff.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to Appear signed by the defendant

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 036290,
Payable Number: 475259,
Receipt Number: 22R 039599,
Amount: $20.00

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

10:33 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Patricia A Plumley in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant will proceed without counsel. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 9/1/22.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
